description:
Earlier this year, two dead bodies were found in identical wetsuits. One was on a beach in Norway, the other on a beach in the Netherlands. The police in both countries were unable to identify the men, but a Norwegian journalist called Anders Fjellberg, from the newspaper Dagbladet, decided to start his own investigation, and he uncovered an astonishing story. On the line from Oslo, he told me what happened.

There was a news story in the middle of February about the discovery of a wetsuit down south in Norway, containing the remains of a human body, and I just saw it on some online newspaper. And my initial reaction was that I hoped it was not somebody I knew because I'm a surfer and there's not that many people who surf around Norway. So I just wanted to check out the story.

And when did you hear about a second body being found in similar circumstances, but this time in the Netherlands?

Yup. This was a couple of days later. The newspaper did a follow-up. They have made connections to the body found in the Netherlands in an identical wetsuit, and the Dutch police have managed to trace both the wetsuits to a shop in Calais in France.

So what was it about this case that really got you interested, that made you want to follow it further?

In the news story, police also said that they had a theory about this being, I think they used the term "illegal migrants", and they also mentioned a connection to something they called "the jungle", which was supposed to be a refugee camp.
